title: About The Project
text:
Welcome to Kenme’s project website!
I am a second-year Communications & New Media student at NUS. I’m interested in fashion, pop culture and the media (of course)! Hence, my project is about Taylor Swift’s music and how it resonates with audiences. This looks at the genres of music she has produced and its correlation with its popularity, as well as the use of certain themes or lyrics.
This data set contains information from Genius about Taylor Swift’s discography, including the number of page visits for each song. As the Genius website features the song lyrics of each song and an analysis of their lyrics, it serves as a reflection of the popularity of Taylor Swift’s music as only those truly interested in it would search for this information.
This analysis can help to inform Taylor Swift’s executives and producers on how her future music should sound like in order to maximise the number of listens per song and increase overall profits.





Have a listen to some of her music here!

title: An Analysis of Taylor Swift’s Discography
text:
Let’s take a look at how Taylor Swift’s music has changed over time, by looking at the genres of music she’s produced.
 
From the data above, we can see that Taylor Swift moved away from folk and country genres to fully embrace pop as her main genre of music over the years. For instance, in her album Reputation, pop was the overwhelming primary genre. However, in recent albums such as folklore, evermore and Midnights, there is a resurgence of songs in the american folk, country and ballad genres.

title: An Analysis of Taylor Swift’s Discography
text:
Let’s take a look at how Taylor Swift’s music has changed over time, by looking at the genres of music she’s produced.
 
From the data above, we can see that Taylor Swift moved away from folk and country genres to fully embrace pop as her main genre of music over the years. For instance, in her album Reputation, pop was the overwhelming primary genre. However, in recent albums such as folklore, evermore and Midnights, there is a resurgence of songs in the american folk, country and ballad genres.
However, which albums did the best in terms of average page views per song?





From this analysis, it seems like folklore, a primarily folk-pop album was most popular. Since users mainly use the Genius website to search for lyrics, it can be inferred that the highest number of users wanted to know more about the lyrics of the songs on the album. Let’s look even further into this – what keywords in Taylor’s folklore album came up the most?

title: An Analysis of Taylor Swift’s Discography
text:
Let’s take a look at how Taylor Swift’s music has changed over time, by looking at the genres of music she’s produced.
 
From the data above, we can see that Taylor Swift moved away from folk and country genres to fully embrace pop as her main genre of music over the years. For instance, in her album Reputation, pop was the overwhelming primary genre. However, in recent albums such as folklore, evermore and Midnights, there is a resurgence of songs in the american folk, country and ballad genres.

title: An Analysis of Taylor Swift’s Discography
section: Heatmap of genres against song page views
text:
Heatmap of genres against song page views
However, how does this relate to the average song page views she received?





From this analysis, it seems that that recent albums which showcase American Folk and Folk are most popular, which are genres not explored by Swift since her debut self-titled album, “Taylor Swift” in 2006.

title: An Analysis of Taylor Swift’s Discography
section: Which producers made the best music?
text:
Which producers made the best music?
So, who is behind this move to produce more songs in these genres? Who on her team knew which direction to go in? Analysing this will allow Swift to choose the right producers to make music with her in the future.





Since the album “folklore” was released in 2020, we can look at the producers who worked on bringing this new sound to life. Aside from Swift herself, this would most prominently be Christopher Rowe, Jack Antonoff, Aaron Dessner and William Bowery.

title: An Analysis of Taylor Swift’s Discography
section: Which producers made music that listeners cared most about?
text:
Which producers made music that listeners cared most about?
Out of the top producers, which ones made tracks that people were most interested in? From this boxplot, we can see that the median song page views were highest for those written by William Bowery.
 
So, who is William Bowery?





Surprise! William Bowery is actually Taylor Swift’s ex, Joe Alwyn. He produced many of the tracks on “folklore” with her, under this pseudonym. To read more about William and his contributions to Swift’s songs, click here.

title: An Analysis of Taylor Swift’s Discography
section: Additional Analysis: Colours of the albums
text:
Additional Analysis: Colours of the albums
Since users mainly use the Genius website to search for lyrics, it can be inferred that the highest number of users wanted to know more about the lyrics of the songs on the album. For Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour, many fans want to dress up according to the colour scheme of each album. This chart can help fans figure out what colours appeared the most, and plan their outfits accordingly!
